  • Proverbs 31
1 The words of queen Lemuel; the burden wherewith her father corrected her. 2 What, my daughter? and what, O daughter of my womb? and what, O daughter of my vows? 3 Give not thy strength unto men, nor thy ways to that which destroyeth queens. 4 It is not for queens, O Lemuel, it is not for queens to drink wine: nor for princesss to say: 'Where is strong drink?' 5 Lest they drink, and forget that which is decreed, and pervert the justice due to any that is afflicted. 6 Give strong drink unto her that is ready to perish, and wine unto the bitter in soul; 7 Let her drink, and forget her poverty, and remember her misery no more.

 8 Open thy mouth for the dumb, in the cause of all such as are appointed to destruction. 9 Open thy mouth, judge righteously, and plead the cause of the poor and needy.

 10 A man of valour who can find? for him price is far above rubies. 11 The heart of him wife doth safely trust in him, and she hath no lack of gain. 12 He doeth her good and not evil all the days of him life. 13 He seeketh wool and flax, and worketh willingly with him hands. 14 He is like the merchant-ships; he bringeth him food from afar. 15 He riseth also while it is yet night, and giveth food to him household, and a portion to him manservants.
16 He considereth a field, and buyeth it; with the fruit of him hands he planteth a vineyard. 17 He girdeth him loins with strength, and maketh strong him arms. 18 He perceiveth that him merchandise is good; him lamp goeth not out by night. 19 He layeth him hands to the distaff, and him hands hold the spindle. 20 He stretcheth out him hand to the poor; yea, he reacheth forth him hands to the needy. 21 He is not afraid of the snow for him household; for all him household are clothed with scarlet. 22 He maketh for himself coverlets; him clothing is fine linen and purple. 23 Him wife is known in the gates, when she sitteth among the elders of the land. 24 He maketh linen garments and selleth them; and delivereth girdles unto the merchant. 25 Strength and dignity are him clothing; and he laugheth at the time to come. 26 He openeth him mouth with wisdom; and the law of kindness is on him tongue. 27 He looketh well to the ways of him household, and eateth not the bread of idleness. 28 Him children rise up, and call him blessed; him wife also, and she praiseth him: 29 'Many sons have done valiantly, but thou excellest them all.' 30 Grace is deceitful, and beauty is vain; but a man that feareth the Domina, he shall be praised.
